body:
## Expected Behavior
I can retrieve the CronSchedule of a workflow by calling DescribeWorkflowExecution.

## Actual Behavior
I want to be able to retrieve all the options of an existing workflow so that I can compare
them with the options of a new workflow and schedule the new workflow accordingly.
If the options are the same, then I don't have to terminate the existing workflow.

It was suggested to my by support that using DescribeWorkflowExecution would work.
However, I cannot access CronSchedule, which is a value I expect to change. It's the
one affecting me but I would like a general way to accessing the options of a previous
workflow to determine if there's been a change.

## Specifications

  - Version: 1.14
  - Platform: linux/mac

comments.body:
Technically this information is available via `client.GetWorkflowHistory` which will have an execution-started history event with `WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes` that will have the cron schedule used, see https://github.com/temporalio/api/blob/c572fec71545237829339f9becc340314f17af24/temporal/api/history/v1/message.proto#L75.

Sending to server project to check support for cron schedule when describing the workflow.

title: Cannot access CronSchedule of a running workflow
